'Cangjie programming language_exception_runtime_common_runtime_exceptions': 'In Cangjie code language, Cangjie provides several built-in exception classes that developers can use directly. These exceptions are commonly encountered during runtime and are used to handle specific error conditions.
| Exception                         | Description                                                                     |
| --------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `ConcurrentModificationException` | Thrown when a concurrent modification occurs.                                   |
| `IllegalArgumentException`        | Thrown when an illegal or inappropriate argument is passed.                     |
| `NegativeArraySizeException`      | Thrown when attempting to create an array with a negative size.                 |
| `NoneValueException`              | Thrown when a value does not exist, such as when a key is not found in a `Map`. |
| `OverflowException`               | Thrown when an arithmetic operation exceeds the maximum value of its data type. |'
